# Elder Helper Services Tender Announcement
## Advance Contract Award Notice

The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) intends to award a contract to a pre-identified supplier for Elder Helper Services in the Ontario region.

### Contract Description

The CSC requires the provision of Elder programming to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders. The successful supplier will assist Indigenous offenders to benefit from traditional healing and contemporary treatment interventions by supporting the work of Elders and the interdisciplinary team.

### Key Responsibilities

* Assist Indigenous offenders to participate in traditional ceremonies
* Provide guidance and counseling according to traditional teachings
* Conduct group discussions and teachings
* Assist in preparing reports (verbal and written)
* Provide cultural awareness sessions to staff

### Evaluation Criteria

To be considered, interested suppliers must demonstrate that they meet the following essential requirements:

* A minimum of 2 years of cumulative experience as an Elder Helper
* Experience in assisting and supporting Indigenous offenders, conducting group discussions, and preparing reports (verbal and written)

### Contract Duration and Value

The contract is expected to begin on November 14, 2023, and will run for 4.5 months, with an option to extend for an additional 7 months. The estimated contract value is $94,260.

### Contact Information

For inquiries and to submit a statement of capabilities, please contact:

Danielle Murdoch, Regional Contract Administrator
Correctional Service Canada, Ontario Region
P.O Box 1174, 445 Union Street West
Kingston, Ontario K7L 4Y8
Telephone: 343-422-4831
Email: danielle.murdoch@csc-scc.gc.ca

The closing date for accepting statements of capabilities is November 9, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST. Eligible suppliers are invited to submit their statement of capabilities to demonstrate their qualifications for the contract.  Transactions will be conducted in English only.
